name: schlumbergera-x-buckleyi
light: Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
flower-description: Seasonal bloomer. Flowers are slightly zygomorphic, in shades of red, orange, pink or white. The tube is elongated, weakly oblique; tepals spreading to recurved, of varying lengths. Stamens inserted on the tube.  The flowers hang down.
leaf-description: Leaves are inconspicuous to lacking. They are represented by setaceous, short hairs from areoles between crenations.  See stem information.
stem-description: Flattened stem segments with scalloped edges are tear drop shape.  Each cladode is lightly serrate on the margins, distinguishing it from other species, and have areoles at the tips where the flowers emerge.
